title: How to Make Pumpkin Cranberry Torte

steps.headline: Prepare the oven and pan.
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 375ºF/190ºC. Grease the sheet pan, then line with parchment paper. Sprinkle a little flour on the paper.

steps.headline: Sift the flour into a bowl.
steps.description: Add the baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and salt. Stir to combine.

steps.headline: Beat the eggs in a separate bowl.
steps.description: If using egg replacer, follow the instructions to prepare.

steps.headline: Add the pureed pumpkin to the egg or egg replacer mixture.
steps.description: Mix together quickly. Pour the pumpkin mixture into the dry ingredients gradually. Mix enough to incorporate. Fold in the craisins.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
steps.description: Place in the oven and bake for 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Allow to cool on a wire cooling rack, sitting in the pan.

steps.headline: Prepare the filling/topping in another bowl as the cake cools.
steps.description: Mix the cream cheese or Toffuti, powdered sugar, and topping together. Add the grated ginger root. Mix to combine.

steps.headline: Mold the cake into a mold when cooled enough to handle.
steps.description: Grease the mold and sprinkle powdered sugar over the greased edges.

steps.headline: Cut the cake into quarters.
steps.description: Press the first quarter (or layer) into the mold. Spread the topping over it. Place another quarter over the first and spread the filling again. Keep molding until all the cake has been inserted into the mold.

steps.headline: Place the cake over a serving plate and carefully tap it out of the mold.
Spread the remaining topping over the top of the molded cake.

text: Prepare the oven and pan. Preheat the oven to 375ºF/190ºC. Grease the sheet pan, then line with parchment paper. Sprinkle a little flour on the paper. Sift the flour into a bowl. Add the baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and salt. Stir to combine. Beat the eggs in a separate bowl. If using egg replacer, follow the instructions to prepare. Add the pureed pumpkin to the egg or egg replacer mixture. Mix together quickly. Pour the pumpkin mixture into the dry ingredients gradually. Mix enough to incorporate. Fold in the craisins. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Place in the oven and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven. Allow to cool on a wire cooling rack, sitting in the pan. Prepare the filling/topping in another bowl as the cake cools. Mix the cream cheese or Toffuti, powdered sugar, and topping together. Add the grated ginger root. Mix to combine. Mold the cake into a mold when cooled enough to handle. Grease the mold and sprinkle powdered sugar over the greased edges. Cut the cake into quarters. Press the first quarter (or layer) into the mold. Spread the topping over it. Place another quarter over the first and spread the filling again. Keep molding until all the cake has been inserted into the mold. Place the cake over a serving plate and carefully tap it out of the mold.  Spread the remaining topping over the top of the molded cake. Add decorations. Serve.  Finished.
